meanings.definition: To add fluoride to (a water supply)
meanings.sent1: The city is fluoridating the water to keep our teeth healthy.
meanings.sent2: The dentist recommends fluoridating the community water for better dental health.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kids thought about fluoridating the school fountain as a prank.
meanings.sent4: Fluoridating the water is like giving it a protective shield against cavities.
meanings.sent5: Imagine fluoridating the ocean to prevent tooth decay for all marine creatures.

meanings.definition: To treat or impregnate with fluoride
meanings.sent1: The dentist is fluoridating the toothpaste to make it more effective.
meanings.sent2: It is important to fluoridate dental products for better oral health.
meanings.sent3: She joked about fluoridating her brother's drink to make him brush his teeth more.
meanings.sent4: Fluoridating the mouthwash gives it extra strength to fight cavities.
meanings.sent5: The idea of fluoridating food for stronger teeth is gaining popularity.

meanings.sent1: The school's water supply will be fluoridating next week.
meanings.sent2: The dental clinic is fluoridating all their equipment for safety reasons.
meanings.sent3: The old pipes in the house were fluoridating slowly over time.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to be fluoridating as she drank the fluoridated water.
meanings.sent5: The process of fluoridating can improve the overall health of the community.
